roleset.name: to obtain with some difficulty

example.name: transitive
example.text: And some grain analysts are predicting that corn prices might gyrate this month as exporters scrounge [*-1] to find enough of the crop to meet their obligations to the Soviets .
example.arg: to find enough of the crop to meet their obligations to the Soviets

example.name: prepositional Arg1
example.text: The man who wore out his shoes wandering around Guadalajara in 1958 , describing in his travel book `` Viaje a la Alcarria '' how-2 he scrounged for food and stayed in squalid inns [*T*-2] , now tours Spain in a Rolls-Royce .

roleset.note: SCROUNGE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls hunt-35.1. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from scrounge.01-v)
